long_description:
Floot lets non-coders & entrepreneurs build real web apps that actually work. Weâ€™re taking a new approach by building everything from the ground up for AI. Since June, 3000+ users have created over 4000 apps on Floot.

Existing AI app builders fall short of enabling non-coders to build real, serious apps. They often:
- Break down when building anything more than a prototype or toy app
- Have non-coders stuck with errors they donâ€™t understand
- Require non-coders to handle multiple services designed for developers (e.g. for backend, database, hosting, etc)

The fundamental problem: these AI app builders just cobble together existing developer tools and slap AI on top, but these tools were designed for humans and not for AI.

The result? Non-coders get excited, start building, hit a wall, and then abandon their projects.

Floot is purpose-built for AI. Our secret sauce:
1) Instead of reusing a coding framework designed for humans, we created a specialized framework that dictates how AI should write code and how the code runs on our infrastructure. This allows us to enforce best practices, detect errors earlier, and give the best feedback to the AI. As a result, Floot can write better code and fix issues more effectively.
2) Floot has the entire tech stack built-in (backend, database, hosting, etc) so building and managing an app feels seamless, especially for non-coders. And because we control every layer of the stack, we can optimize each layer for AI-first coding.

Because of this, non-coders can get more done with less time and prompting. They can finally build serious apps that work, instead of getting stuck in frustrating error loops and then abandoning their projects.

We also built a highly scalable hosting system directly on AWS so Floot apps can handle real traffic and business demands. This means non-coders can build, deploy, and scale their apps on a single platform seamlessly.

Plus, Floot is really fun to use! Try building an app at floot.com

We handle the hard parts of running browser infrastructure in the cloud so you donâ€™t have to: spinning up browsers quickly, responsive read/write live view, logs, headless vs. headful mode, replays, residential proxies, and more. Our API allows developers to instantly launch browsers in the cloud, so you can focus on your core product logic rather than the infra underneath.

Our customers use Kernel to launch QA agents, vertical-specific agents that automate back office processes, and more.

We're open source, HIPAA-compliant (SOC2 Type 2 pending), & compatible with every browser/web agent framework (Playwright, Puppeteer, CUA, Browser Use, Magnitude, etc). Check us out â€”> https://github.com/onkernel/kernel-images
one_liner: High performance browsers-as-a-service for web agents & automations

name: dScribe AI
long_description:
dScribe AI uses autonomous drones and 3D vision to track bulk inventory. We're starting by helping the ag and mining industry track stockpiles of grain and gravel.

Bulk inventory tracking is broken. Companies either rely on guesstimates or pay for expensive manual surveys which are still off by 20 to 30%. Without accurate numbers, itâ€™s hard to plan logistics, like how many truckloads are needed. And it creates accounting issues by misreporting inventory value, hurting financial planning and leading to missed opportunities.

Weâ€™ve lived this problem, and we know how to solve it. Warren saw it firsthand as a Product Manager at Milk Moovement, a $20M Series A AgTech startup, working closely with feed suppliers and farm managers. Jordan scaled Microsoft Azureâ€™s largest public API, handling over 700M requests/month, and sold software to a public company. Cole was engineer #3 at Tropic, scaling it from seed to Series B, and later led engineering at an AI startup.

Weâ€™ve built an integrated hardware and software platform thatâ€™s now being piloted by some of the largest agriculture and construction companies in North America. As industries demand real-time visibility into the physical world, dScribe AI is positioned to become the system of record for inventory that donâ€™t fit in traditional boxes and barcodes.
one_liner: Track bulk inventory with autonomous drones and 3D vision

name: Okibi
long_description:
Whether you're building anÂ internal workflow automation to remove repetitive or time consuming tasks, or launching your own product with Agents,Â Okibi can help you build it.

Building AI agents typically requiresÂ complex,Â time-consumingÂ setup, includingÂ tool calling,Â LLM syntax management,Â multi-agent orchestration,Â browser use,Â evals, andÂ hosting deployments.

Our web app provides aÂ chat interfaceÂ and toolkit to easily create agents.Â Just describe your agent in natural language, similar to vibecoding, and our app automatically generates your agent's architecture, tool calls, human in the loop, browser user, and runs evals on your agent.

This approachÂ significantly reduces development complexity and time.
one_liner: Build agents using natural language, it's Lovable for agents

name: Juxta
long_description:
Juxta is creating the first Universal Positioning System (UPS) â€” a GPS alternative that can monitor movement anywhere on earth with no new hardware, minimal internet connection, and remote deployment. Using custom machine learning models and a first-of-its-kind synthetic fingerprinting technology, Juxta can make any indoor, outdoor, or underground space location-aware in minutes for a fraction of the cost of any other geospatial technology.

Juxta's UPS can be leveraged across industries â€” from securely tracking soldiers in combat zones to providing offline positioning for robots to offering asset tracking in warehouses and ports around the globe.
one_liner: Building a GPS alternative 100x more powerful with no hardware needed.

name: stagewise
long_description:
stagewise is the first frontend coding agent for existing production-grade web apps. It lives right inside your browser, makes changes in your local codebase and is compatible with all kinds of frameworks and setups - allowing it to be retrofitted into any existing project.

Our agent enables you to show and tell what you want to change - all while using your app on localhost and without having to switch to external tools. Making changes is as easy as selecting elements, giving a simple prompt like â€œmake it green and put it in the top right cornerâ€, and immediately seeing the result.

We're two founders from Germany who met while working at a B2B SaaS startup. With backgrounds in both enterprise engineering (Rheinmetall, dSPACE) and building web apps used by thousands, we have the unique blend of discipline and product sense needed to build this.

After making our initial launch with the open-sourced toolbar that puts your favorite coding agent right inside your browser and going viral with it, weâ€™re now launching a high-speed coding agent dedicated to frontend development - taking our product and the experience of our users to the next level.

Our vision is to empower anyone to create well-designed applications, regardless of their technical skill. We start with developers who lack design experience, but our ultimate goal is to change how products are built. stagewise will enable non-technical stakeholders - product managers, designers, and marketers - to directly iterate on the UI themselves, creating a new, collaborative workflow and making us the essential tool for building on the web.
one_liner: The frontend coding agent for production codebases

name: Clodo
long_description:
Clodo is the AI Assistant for Real Estate Agents. 

Clodo helps agents remember and follow up with all their leads. Building up your database and following up with leads are the two most valuable actions you can perform as a real estate agent. Currently, both of these tasks involve spending hours sifting through dashboards and spreadsheets, and a lot of guesswork.

With Clodo, we see agents effortlessly performing both those tasks and turning their database into a stronger engine for business.
one_liner: The AI Assistant for Real Estate Agents
subindustry: Real Estate and Construction -> Housing and Real Estate

name: Fleetline
long_description: Fleetline is building the first complete-context algorithmic load planner forÂ mid to large-sized trucking fleets. Todayâ€™s dispatchers face an overwhelming task: balancing regulations, customer demands, live fleet data, and individual driver needs, all while coordinating across siloed tools and teams. Mistakes run rampant, and each mistake is thousands of dollars. Even the select fleets using algorithms that have fleet-wide context struggle: the outputs are rigid, hard to interpret, and are blind to real-world nuances like driver preferences and schedule exceptions. Fleetline solves this by combining advanced optimization with LLMs that can easily adapt algorithms to each fleetâ€™s needs and capture driver-specific information. The result is smarter planning truly optimized for every fleet and its drivers.
one_liner: Optimizing fleet planning with data driven algorithms

name: Magnetic
long_description:
Magnetic scans client documents - from handwritten charity notes to excel spreadsheet Schedule Cs to multi-state K-1s - and enters them into tax software automatically, saving hours of tedious data entry. 

The accounting profession is facing a massive talent shortage, as graduates choose different professions and the old guard begins to retire. As a result, CPA and tax preparation firms are awash in clientele, but unable to keep up. At many firms, phones go unanswered, clients are "fired", and websites are taken down, as the existing workforce tries to handle the grueling 80 hour+ weeks necessary to push through tax season to the April 15th deadline.

We built this because a former colleague who owns her own tax firm asked us to automate her workload, and we quickly realized the massive opportunity. Thomas brings deep domain expertise as the former Head of Product at Keeper (YC W19), where he built tax engine automation systems and an OCR form scanning system that outperformed everything else on the market. At Keeper, he leveraged early access to OpenAI's LLMs (well before ChatGPT) to build systems that automated the entire tax filing process, allowing a tiny team of CPAs to process thousands of returns with near zero busy work. Patrick was the first engineer at FunCraft, shipping multiple mobile games with 1M+ downloads and building scalable shared codebases. We've worked together since 2017, including co-leading multiple teams at Zynga as PM & Tech Lead respectively.

We launched this year in the middle of tax season and quickly processed hundreds of returns, earning thousands in ARR, and since tax season we've been growing customers by >30% month-over-month. We've completely automated over 25% of the return process so far and developed a proprietary vision model that beats incumbent scanning technology by almost 2x on accuracy - jumping from 50% field-level accuracy to 89%, approaching the quality of their expensive human-verified service at 92%.

The opportunity is massive - there are 80M US personal tax returns filed via professionals annually, in a $2B outsourcing market where individual CPA firms currently pay $100k-$1M per year for inferior services. We're positioned to capture significant market share by offering better accuracy & document coverage, instant processing, and superior user experience.

We've built this kind of software before, we've worked together for years (and even lived together), we've built products to $10M ARR before, and we have the grit to outwork anyone in this space.
one_liner: AI tax preparation for CPAs

name: Modelence
long_description:
You built the demo in a weekend. Now you need auth, a prod-grade database, real-time events, AI observability, cron jobs, email, monitoringâ€¦ and you needed them yesterday.

We spent a decade at our previous startup, building a platform while scaling to millions of users and customers like Meta & Netflix. Now we put that into an open-source framework, so others wouldnâ€™t have to do the same from scratch.

Modelence is a batteries-included framework that abstracts away boilerplate so you can just focus on building your product logic and nothing else - itâ€™s like Next.js + Vercel + Supabase on a single platform, built for full-stack TypeScript.

Shipping production apps is much harder than building a prototype that runs locally and 95% of all production apps share the same building blocks. We did a massive amount of work on our previous platforms that was not specific to our product, and weâ€™ve created Modelence to abstract that away:
- Authentication
- Database setup
- Hosting / CDN
- AI integration (LLM observability, prompts)
- Real-time events
- Cron jobs
- Email service
- Monitoring
- Analytics
- Admin dashboards

Andrej Karpathy recently posted about this same exact problem:
https://x.com/karpathy/status/1905051558783418370

and explained it further in his YC AI Startup School talk:
https://youtu.be/LCEmiRjPEtQ?feature=shared&t=1940
one_liner: All-in-one TypeScript platform for startups

Sam (CEO) was previously the co-founder and CEO of a DevOps platform that raisedâ€¯$2M. Taira (CTO) was the youngest SDE 2 at AWS Sagemaker Inference. We have over five years of experience handling technical support for customers ranging from small startups to Fortune 500 companies like Salesforce.

We came into YC with just an idea, and we already have our first pilot customer paying $5 per support ticket.

In short: Vulcan equips agencies to comply with changing state and federal law, and enables business to comment, contest, and comply with regulatory requirements.

name: Uplift AI
long_description:
We build speech understanding and speech generation models for the five major languages spoken in Pakistan, where 42% of the adult population can not read any language. 

Pakistan is the 5th most populous country in the world with a $411 billion GDP. Yet its overlooked and no practical voice models exist for the local languages.

With our APIs and SDKs, businesses offer high-quality voice interfaces in domains like banking, agriculture, healthcare, and government services. This enables them to finally offer digital services to every customer -- often for the first time.

Our founding team has a decade of experience building world-leading voice products, including at Alexa and Siri. We have launched entire AWS services; and software written by us previously is used by millions daily.

We do in-house research and development. We gather our own data, then train and deploy our own models. We own our technology stack end-to-end.

We are on a mission to uplift entire nations through better access to digital information and digital services.
one_liner: Foundational Voice AI for underserved languages

name: Blue
long_description:
Blue is the first voice assistant that can control every app on your phone.

Most assistants today, such as Siri, Alexa, or Gemini, are limited to narrow functions like setting timers or answering questions. They cannot message your friends on Messenger, send money on Venmo, or compare ride-share prices to book the best option.

Blue can do all of this and more.

It taps, swipes, and types like a human on both Android and iPhone, so it doesn't need any app-specific integrations. This is made possible through a voice-first computer-use model as well as a custom hardware. 

It already works in the real world. Users are texting, shopping, and navigating their phones completely hands-free. People who are commuting, cooking, or multitasking are using Blue to reclaim meaningful time during their day.

Our team brings rare and highly complementary experience. Omar led Google Assistantâ€™s transition to LLMs and holds one of the earliest patents in LLM-based computer control. Peter brings decades of experience designing and building voice-first dialog systems, holds multiple design patents, and was most recently the design lead at Google DeepMind serving actions on the Gemini Live model. Farhan helped ship Appleâ€™s Vision Pro and holds more than 50 patents in hardware and systems design. He's also led several products end-to-end from early prototyping to mass production and global fulfillment.

Together, we have built systems used by billions of people and are now building something even more fundamental: re-inventing the way we use and interact with technology.
one_liner: The first voice assistant that can control every app on your phone.
